message.entry: Function ''{0}'' is not supported for gpsdev object.

Obtaining the required NMEA sentences (RMC, GGA and GSA) is taking longer than expected. Verify the physical connection of the GPS device to the specified serial port and the configuration of the GPS device.
Unable to call writeBytes function because the gpsdev object is in use. Release the object first and then try again.
Unable to connect to the device. Verify that the device is connected to the port, the port is not in use, and all input arguments and Name-Value pairs are supported by the device.
Dropping data due to incorrect checksum in ''{0}'' sentence.
Invalid message ID. Ensure all the steps for adding a new message are followed.
This feature requires a license for the Navigation Toolbox.
'CustomSentence' value must be a cell array. Each element of the cell array must be a string array or cell array of character vectors of message ID and function name.
MessageID for the 'CustomSentence' value must be a string or a character array.
Function specified for 'CustomSentence' value must be a string or character array of the custom function name or passed as a function handle.
Function specified for 'CustomSentence' value is not a valid MATLAB function.

">{0} is specified for both 'MessageIDs' property and 'CustomSentence' value. Either use the supported property value to parse {0} or specify {0} as custom message ID to override the built-in support.
